translated: podżegać do złego, pomagać w przestępstwie
explanation: to help or encourage someone to do something wrong or illegal
sentence: His accountant had aided and abetted him in the fraud.
sentence_gap: His accountant had aided and _______ him in the fraud.

explanation: to not do something, especially something enjoyable that you think might be bad; to choose not to use a vote
sentence: He took a vow to abstain from alcohol.
sentence_gap: He took a vow to _______ from alcohol.

explanation: formal; the ability to hear, see, or think accurately and clearly
sentence: Tiredness also affects visual acuity.
sentence_gap: Tiredness also affects visual ______.

explanation: skill in making correct decisions and judgments in a particular subject, such as business or politics
sentence: He is an astute man with sound business acumen.
sentence_gap: He is an astute man with sound business ______.

explanation: the person or people mentioned earlier
sentence: The aforementioned Mr Parkes then entered the cinema.
sentence_gap: The ______________ Mr Parkes then entered the cinema.

explanation: having some of the same qualities
sentence: They speak a language akin to French.
sentence_gap: They speak a language ____ to French.

explanation: something that helps to provide comfort, convenience, or enjoyment
sentence: The campsite's amenities include a pool and three restaurants.
sentence_gap: The campsite's _________ include a pool and three restaurants.

explanation: very dry and without enough rain for plants
sentence: The desert is so arid that nothing can grow there.
sentence_gap: The desert is so ____ that nothing can grow there.

explanation: formal
sentence: Her business empire brought her wealth beyond the dreams of avarice (= an extremely large amount of money).
sentence_gap: Her business empire brought her wealth beyond the dreams of _______ (= an extremely large amount of money).

explanation: formal; threatening to do something bad or to hurt someone
sentence: He gave me a baleful look.
sentence_gap: He gave me a _______ look.

sentence: She wore a necklace of brightly colored wooden beads.
sentence_gap: She wore a necklace of brightly colored wooden _____.

explanation: literary
sentence: His accusations were false, but they served to besmirch her reputation.
sentence_gap: His accusations were false, but they served to ________ her reputation.

explanation: happily and without feeling or showing any worry, especially when there is a reason to be worried
sentence: She blithely agreed to the contract without realizing what its consequences would be.
sentence_gap: She ________ agreed to the contract without realizing what its consequences would be.

explanation: to become pink in the face, usually from embarrassment
sentence: I always blush when I speak in public.
sentence_gap: I always _____ when I speak in public.

explanation: literary; a pleasant place under the branches of a tree in a wood or garden
sentence: On the ground outside the bower are two juvenile males.
sentence_gap: On the ground outside the _____ are two juvenile males.

explanation: a man who is about to get married or has just got married
sentence: The bridegroom was late for the ceremony.
sentence_gap: The __________ was late for the ceremony.

explanation: a sudden, bad event that causes a lot of damage or unhappiness
sentence: A series of calamities ruined them - floods, a failed harvest, and the death of a son.
sentence_gap: A series of __________ ruined them - floods, a failed harvest, and the death of a son.

explanation: to fill the gaps around the edge of something, for example a bath or shower, with a special substance
sentence: Calk all cracks between the trim and siding or masonry.
sentence_gap: ____ all cracks between the trim and siding or masonry.

sentence: It might sound callous, but i don't care if he's homeless. he's not living with me!
sentence_gap: It might sound _______, but i don't care if he's homeless. he's not living with me!

explanation: a cover fixed over a seat or bed, etc. for shelter or decoration
sentence: We could see the sky through gaps in the forest canopy.
sentence_gap: We could see the sky through gaps in the forest ______.

explanation: often expressing criticisms about matters that are not important
sentence: I only desire to say that this is not captious criticism.
sentence_gap: I only desire to say that this is not ________ criticism.

sentence: Gently he caressed her cheek.
sentence_gap: Gently he ________ her cheek.

explanation: (of a bell or a clock) to ring; to show the time by making a ringing sound
sentence: Eight o'clock had already chimed.
sentence_gap: Eight o'clock had already ______.

sentence: The boy suffered a broken collarbone and was taken to hospital.
sentence_gap: The boy suffered a broken __________ and was taken to hospital.

sentence: The conceit of that man is incredible!
sentence_gap: The _______ of that man is incredible!

explanation: to work secretly to do something wrong or illegal, or to allow something wrong or illegal to happen
sentence: They accused the government of conniving in drug smuggling.
sentence_gap: They accused the government of _________ in drug smuggling.

explanation: formal; to say that something is true or is a fact
sentence: The lawyer contended (that) her client had never been near the scene of the crime.
sentence_gap: The lawyer _________ (that) her client had never been near the scene of the crime.

explanation: an elected member of a local government
sentence: A councilor is a member of some type of governing body, and its definition refers to a public official who is responsible for creating rules and laws within their jurisdiction.
sentence_gap: A _________ is a member of some type of governing body, and its definition refers to a public official who is responsible for creating rules and laws within their jurisdiction.

explanation: to try harder to prevent an illegal activity and deal more severely with those who are caught doing it
sentence: The library is cracking down on people who lose their books.
sentence_gap: The library is _____________ on people who lose their books.

explanation: a small bed for a baby, especially one that moves from side to side
sentence: The nurse rocked the cradle.
sentence_gap: The nurse rocked the ______.

sentence: Most of the year the insects are hidden in rock crevices.
sentence_gap: Most of the year the insects are hidden in rock ________.

explanation: old-fashioned; attractive in a confident, exciting, and stylish way
sentence: She married a dashing young lawyer from the city.
sentence_gap: She married a _______ young lawyer from the city.

explanation: to spoil something or someone so that that thing or person is less beautiful or pure
sentence: It's a shame that such a beautiful area has been defiled by a rubbish dump.
sentence_gap: It's a shame that such a beautiful area has been _______ by a rubbish dump.

explanation: literary; a small valley, usually with trees
sentence: The dell was carved by a creek that includes two fairly substantial tumbling waterfalls.
sentence_gap: The ____ was carved by a creek that includes two fairly substantial tumbling waterfalls.

explanation: a small hollow mark in the surface of something, caused by pressure or by being hit
sentence: She ran into my car and put a dent in it.
sentence_gap: She ran into my car and put a ____ in it.

explanation: to prevent someone from doing something or to make someone less enthusiastic about doing something by making it difficult for that person to do it or by threatening bad results if they do it
sentence: These measures are designed to deter an enemy attack.
sentence_gap: These measures are designed to _____ an enemy attack.

explanation: used to refer to people or things that you hate very much
sentence: All terrorist crime is detestable, whoever the victims.
sentence_gap: All terrorist crime is __________, whoever the victims.

explanation: to say that you know nothing about something, or that you have no responsibility for or connection with something
sentence: She tried to disavow her past.
sentence_gap: She tried to _______ her past.

explanation: literary; to send many people out of a place or vehicle at the same time; to release large amounts of liquid, gas, or other contents
sentence: The delayed commuter train disgorged hundreds of angry passengers.
sentence_gap: The delayed commuter train _________ hundreds of angry passengers.

sentence: The car left the road and ended up in a ditch.
sentence_gap: The car left the road and ended up in a _____.

explanation: a large group of animals, especially cattle or sheep, moving from one place to another
sentence: People were leaving the countryside in droves to look for work in the cities.
sentence_gap: People were leaving the countryside in ______ to look for work in the cities.

explanation: formal; a large building, especially an impressive one
sentence: The town hall is the only edifice surviving from the 15th century.
sentence_gap: The town hall is the only _______ surviving from the 15th century.

explanation: to be a perfect example of a quality or type of thing
sentence: The fighting qualities of the team are epitomized by the captain.
sentence_gap: The fighting qualities of the team are __________ by the captain.

sentence: He was clever, handsome, and exceedingly rich.
sentence_gap: He was clever, handsome, and ___________ rich.

sentence: He felt an excruciating pain in the lower back.
sentence_gap: He felt an ____________ pain in the lower back.

explanation: an evil and cruel person
sentence: He was portrayed in the media as a complete fiend.
sentence_gap: He was portrayed in the media as a complete _____.

explanation: a relative who lived in the past; literary
sentence: How the world has changed: occasionally we rediscover long-forgotten truths that our forebears knew well.
sentence_gap: How the world has changed: occasionally we rediscover long-forgotten truths that our _________ knew well.

explanation: goods, but not passengers, that are carried from one place to another, by ship, aircraft, train, or truck, or the system of transporting these goods
sentence: The ship carries both freight and passengers.
sentence_gap: The ship carries both _______ and passengers.

explanation: not clear in shape or sound
sentence: Is the picture always fuzzy on your TV?
sentence_gap: Is the picture always _____ on your TV?

explanation: having the habit of talking a lot, esp. about unimportant things
sentence: I had talked too much about myself and felt like a garrulous old fool.
sentence_gap: I had talked too much about myself and felt like a _________ old fool.

explanation: to rub food against a grater in order to cut it into a lot of small pieces
sentence: Grate the cheese and sprinkle it over the tomatoes.
sentence_gap: _____ the cheese and sprinkle it over the tomatoes.

explanation: (of people) liking to be with other people
sentence: Emma's a gregarious, outgoing sort of person.
sentence_gap: Emma's a __________, outgoing sort of person.

sentence: I found the book so gripping that I couldn't put it down.
sentence_gap: I found the book so ________ that I couldn't put it down.

explanation: what something seems to be, although it is not; formal
sentence: The men who arrived in the guise of drug dealers were actually undercover police officers.
sentence_gap: The men who arrived in the _____ of drug dealers were actually undercover police officers.

explanation: in a way that is not intentional
sentence: He inadvertently deleted the file.
sentence_gap: He _____________ deleted the file.

explanation: designed to cause fires
sentence: He gave an incendiary speech at last night’s rally.
sentence_gap: He gave an __________ speech at last night’s rally.

explanation: formal; to experience something, usually something unpleasant, as a result of actions you have taken
sentence: She had incurred the wrath of her father by marrying without his consent
sentence_gap: She had ________ the wrath of her father by marrying without his consent

sentence: Cases of infanticide often involve extreme emotional disturbance.
sentence_gap: Cases of ___________ often involve extreme emotional disturbance.

explanation: the action of forcing someone to experience something very unpleasant
sentence: Physical abuse involves the infliction of physical injury on a child.
sentence_gap: Physical abuse involves the __________ of physical injury on a child.

explanation: to write or cut words, your name, etc. onto something
sentence: She signed the book and inscribed the words “with grateful thanks” on it.
sentence_gap: She signed the book and _________ the words “with grateful thanks” on it.

explanation: continuing for too long and therefore boring or annoying
sentence: The drive seemed interminable.
sentence_gap: The drive seemed ____________.

explanation: specialized; a group of officials who represent their government in a foreign country but who have less importance than an embassy
sentence: The UK has sent a legation to discuss trade and tariffs.
sentence_gap: The UK has sent a ________ to discuss trade and tariffs.

explanation: treatment in which someone is punished or judged less strongly or severely than would be expected
sentence: But for the leniency of the referee, the player would have been sent off.
sentence_gap: But for the ________ of the referee, the player would have been sent off.

explanation: (of a person or animal) to run taking long, relaxed steps
sentence: The lion loped across the grass.
sentence_gap: The lion _____ across the grass.

explanation: a small, flavored candy, often containing medicine, which dissolves when sucked in the mouth
sentence: The final step sees the candy strings cut into rectangular lozenges, then wrapped and packaged.
sentence_gap: The final step sees the candy strings cut into rectangular ________, then wrapped and packaged.

explanation: a shelf above a fireplace, usually part of a frame that surrounds the fireplace
sentence: She has photographs of all her grandchildren on the mantelpiece.
sentence_gap: She has photographs of all her grandchildren on the ___________.

sentence: Gerald committed matricide; he strangled his mother.
sentence_gap: Gerald committed _________; he strangled his mother.

explanation: any unpleasant thick soft substance, such as food that has been cooked for too long
sentence: If you overcook the cabbage it'll turn to mush.
sentence_gap: If you overcook the cabbage it'll turn to ____.

explanation: someone who says something is not possible, is not good, or will fail
sentence: He ignored the naysayers and persevered.
sentence_gap: He ignored the _________ and persevered.

explanation: to eat something by taking a lot of small bites
sentence: A mouse has nibbled through the computer cables.
sentence_gap: A mouse has _______ through the computer cables.

explanation: unreasonably determined, especially to act in a particular way and not to change at all, despite what anyone else says
sentence: He's a very rude and obstinate man.
sentence_gap: He's a very rude and _________ man.

explanation: to repair an engine, machine, etc. so that every part of it works as it should; to completely change a system so that it works more effectively
sentence: I got the engine overhauled.
sentence_gap: I got the engine __________.

sentence: Helen was overjoyed to hear that they had given her the job.
sentence_gap: Helen was _________ to hear that they had given her the job.

explanation: a competition for young women in which they are judged on their beauty and other qualities
sentence: Between games, the traditional pageantry includes the parade of champions.
sentence_gap: Between games, the traditional _________ includes the parade of champions.

sentence: By ten o'clock I was feeling peckish, even though I'd had a large breakfast.
sentence_gap: By ten o'clock I was feeling _______, even though I'd had a large breakfast.

explanation: to get control or influence; to be common among a group of people or area at a particular time
sentence: This attitude still prevails among the middle classes.
sentence_gap: This attitude still ________ among the middle classes.

explanation: to push something or someone with your finger or with a pointed object
sentence: I prodded her in the back to get her attention.
sentence_gap: I _______ her in the back to get her attention.

sentence: The appetite, says the proverb, grows with eating.
sentence_gap: The appetite, says the _______, grows with eating.

explanation: a person who is easily shocked by rude things, especially those of a sexual type
sentence: Don't be such a prude.
sentence_gap: Don't be such a _____.

explanation: old-fashioned; to drink something quickly or in large amounts
sentence: They spent the evening quaffing champagne.
sentence_gap: They spent the evening ________ champagne.

explanation: any set of rules about food and exercise that someone follows, especially in order to improve their health
sentence: After his heart attack the doctor put him on a strict regimen.
sentence_gap: After his heart attack the doctor put him on a strict _______.

explanation: to come or bring something back to life, health, existence, or use
sentence: My plants revived as soon as I gave them some water.
sentence_gap: My plants _______ as soon as I gave them some water.

explanation: faeces (= solid body waste) left by animals
sentence: The bear scat was analysed and found to come from a grizzly.
sentence_gap: The bear ____ was analysed and found to come from a grizzly.

explanation: allowing yourself to have or do anything that you enjoy
sentence: I know it's self-indulgent of me, but I'll have another chocolate.
sentence_gap: I know it's ______________ of me, but I'll have another chocolate.

explanation: UK; offensive
sentence: He was caught shagging his friend’s sister.
sentence_gap: He was caught ________ his friend’s sister.

explanation: something that looks like or represents something else
sentence: In other words, he prefers the bland, dumbed-down sounds which represent a diluted simulacrum of the real thing.
sentence_gap: In other words, he prefers the bland, dumbed-down sounds which represent a diluted __________ of the real thing.

explanation: (especially of hair, clothes, or shapes) smooth, shiny, and lying close to the body, and therefore looking well cared for; not untidy and with no parts sticking out
sentence: The cat had sleek fur.
sentence_gap: The cat had _____ fur.

sentence: I had my arm in a sling for six weeks.
sentence_gap: I had my arm in a _____ for six weeks.

explanation: to move quickly and smoothly in the sky, or to move quickly up into the sky
sentence: The birds were soaring high above.
sentence_gap: The birds were _______ high above.

explanation: formal
sentence: He will be sorely missed by everyone.
sentence_gap: He will be ______ missed by everyone.

explanation: an unpleasantly loud, sharp noise made by a bird
sentence: The owl flew off with a squawk.
sentence_gap: The owl flew off with a ______.

explanation: to crush something that is soft
sentence: Don't sit on that bag - you'll squish the sandwiches.
sentence_gap: Don't sit on that bag - you'll ______ the sandwiches.

explanation: (of a person) calm and not showing emotion or excitement
sentence: Mark sat stolid and silent.
sentence_gap: Mark sat ______ and silent.

explanation: a narrow area of sea that connects two large areas of sea
sentence: The strait lies between the Atlantic Ocean and the Mediterranean Sea.
sentence_gap: The ______ lies between the Atlantic Ocean and the Mediterranean Sea.

explanation: understood without being expressed directly
sentence: By tacit agreement, the subject was never mentioned again.
sentence_gap: By _____ agreement, the subject was never mentioned again.

explanation: a record or count of a number of things
sentence: Keep a tally of how much you spend while you're away.
sentence_gap: Keep a _____ of how much you spend while you're away.

explanation: a sudden period of uncontrolled anger like a young child's
sentence: Children often have temper tantrums at the age of two or thereabout.
sentence_gap: Children often have temper ________ at the age of two or thereabout.

explanation: (of a plan or idea) not certain or agreed, or (of a suggestion or action) said or done in a careful but uncertain way because you do not know if you are right
sentence: I have tentative plans to take a trip to Seattle in July.
sentence_gap: I have _________ plans to take a trip to Seattle in July.

sentence: The thorny issue of illegal immigration remains unresolved.
sentence_gap: The ______ issue of illegal immigration remains unresolved.

sentence: Trachea is the tube that carries air from your throat to your lungs.
sentence_gap: _______ is the tube that carries air from your throat to your lungs.

sentence: Turmeric and cumin are often used to make curries.
sentence_gap: ________ and cumin are often used to make curries.

explanation: a person who has succeeded in business or industry and has become very rich and powerful
sentence: The tycoon can afford to pay for his entertainment, whether it is taxed income or not.
sentence_gap: The ______ can afford to pay for his entertainment, whether it is taxed income or not.

explanation: not able to be understood
sentence: He muttered something unintelligible.
sentence_gap: He muttered something ______________.

explanation: the form of a language that a particular group of speakers use naturally, especially in informal situations
sentence: Many Roman Catholics regret the replacing of the Latin mass by the vernacular.
sentence_gap: Many Roman Catholics regret the replacing of the Latin mass by the __________.

explanation: to make cloth by repeatedly crossing a single thread through two sets of long threads on a loom
sentence: The baskets are woven from strips of willow.
sentence_gap: The baskets are _____ from strips of willow.
